name: Azure Virtual Machine Boot Diagnostics Disabled
description:
This policy identifies Azure Virtual Machines which have Boot Diagnostics setting Disabled. Boot Diagnostics when enabled for the virtual machine, captures a Screenshot and Console Output during virtual machine startup. This would help in troubleshooting the virtual machine when it enters a non-bootable state.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/troubleshooting/boot-diagnostics
searchModel.query: config from cloud.resource where cloud.type = 'azure' AND api.name = 'azure-vm-list' AND json.rule = powerState contains running and ['properties.diagnosticsProfile'].['bootDiagnostics'].['enabled'] is false
recommendation:
1. Log in to the Azure Portal
2. Select 'Virtual Machines' from the left pane
3. Select the reported virtual machine
4. Select 'Boot Diagnostics' under 'Support + troubleshooting'
5. Click on 'Settings'
6. Select 'Enable with managed storage account' setting
7. Click on 'Save'
